cooling-off period.translation[0].defini: a period of time after you have signed some types of sales agreement, when you can change your mind about buying something
Customers signing new life policies will have a cooling-off period of 14 days in which to cancel.
a period of time when two people or groups who are arguing about something can go away and think about how to improve the situation
cooling-off period.translation[1].defini: a period of time, usually between 10 and 20 days, in which you can think about a contract you have just signed and change your mind about entering into it
The new Timeshare Act gives you a 14-day cooling-off period, so you can pull out of buying.
in a disagreement between employers and employees, a period of time during which workers are not allowed to strike or during which employers are not allowed to prevent workers from working
a 90-day cooling-off period before strike action started
